intro: Morisonia quiriguensis, commonly known as the Quirigué morning glory, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family, which includes many vines and climbers. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and violet. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and horticultural interest.
